file_content.text: Take a look at this, my lord... those rakghouls have been busy. This is the ninth corpse I've found today.
Another one of ours--though you could hardly tell by looking. Rakghouls are notoriously messy eaters.
Ah, but where are my own manners? I'm Eton Vok. I research the rakghouls' hunting patterns and social behaviors.
They've always picked off the occasional grunt, true, but this is different.
Admittedly, their interactions are primitive, confusing, even violent, but you can find a message in all the blood-spattered chaos.
This mess is the work of a mutant strain of rakghouls I've been studying. I've dubbed them berserker rakghouls, for obvious reasons.
They've been on the rampage for days now. Even destroyed my camp. I only escaped because they were too busy disemboweling my guards to give chase.
As bad as that incident was, it's only gotten worse since.
These berserkers are unfathomably aggressive. They'll attack Imperial convoys, tear entire squads to pieces--or worse, infect them.
Each massacre heightens their bloodlust and swells their numbers. We need to exterminate them before they're too many to contain.
The rakghouls shouldn't trouble the Empire anymore.
It appears the rakghoul onslaught has finally been suppressed. Imperial operations are already reclaiming lost territory.
And I see you collected the data I requested. Splendid. I only hope our troops can learn to fight the rakghouls as effectively as you.
Here.
And not a moment too soon. I shudder to think what might have happened if those berserkers had run unchecked any longer.
I enjoyed it.
They weren't so tough.
I'm done here.
A pity the berserkers didn't direct their animosity toward the Republic instead. Their mindless savagery--properly guided--could have proven useful.
Perhaps now I can continue my studies in peace. Of course, I'll need to find new subjects....
You'd best hurry--the berserkers' numbers grow with each passing moment.
Look at this... those rakghouls have been busy. This is the ninth corpse I've found today.
I didn't think rakghoul attacks were that uncommon.
Why the fuss?
Are you saying rakghouls can communicate?
Social behaviors?
What is that smell?
Something stinks.
Pungent, isn't it? Rakghouls aren't cannibalistic, so smearing my clothes in their entrails makes me less... palatable to them.
The Empire cannot tolerate such wanton destruction.
This will not stand.
Minions have their uses, even in death.
Better them than you.
Bad things happen when you take on a job you're not cut out for.
They were in over their heads.
Those guards were supposed to protect me. If they had to be mercilessly devoured to do so, then so be it.
This wouldn't have happened if you had taken the necessary precautions.
You were careless.
I'll admit, I didn't anticipate a full-on assault.
Why were you interested in these rakghouls?
What were you studying?
They've developed an immunity to the local toxins. Also, their mutations have made them even more savage than their brethren.
So?
Our troops lack the nerve to fight the rakghouls--one severed head and they all panic.
This requires a powerful Sith... like you, my lord.
This requires a cold, ruthless professional... like you.
This requires an experienced operative... like you.
This requires someone with your skill.
This requires a small, well-trained group... like you.
These berserkers will get a lesson in violence and mayhem.
So be it.
Count me in.
Excellent. Their lair isn't far. Head down there and kill the lot of them.
If it's no trouble, I'd also like to observe your tactics against the rakghouls.
This monitoring device will analyze your fights. Kill enough, and that data could teach our troops how to effectively counter the beasts.
Not interested. [Refuse quest]
Drat. And so, the carnage continues....
These rakghouls are becoming quite a nuisance.
